name: treatment of used powertrain, electric scooter, manual dismantling | used powertrain, electric scooter | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3197/documentation

This dataset describes the treatment of a used  electric drivetrain of an electric scooter. The original dataset has been developed for a drivetrain comprising an electric motor (5.8kg), a controller (1.27kg) and a charger (3.025). First, the drivetrain is manually dismantled to recover all large metal scrap, especially from the electric motor and from the cases of the electronic devices. The scrap steel, copper and aluminium directly recovered from the components is sent to the respective scrap recycling facilities, while the remaining electronics scrap is sent to a smelter facility.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The dataset starts with the electric drivetrain which needs to be dismantled already in the dismantling facility.

The dataset returns the outcome scrap fractions for aluminium, steel, copper, plastic and waste electronics.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: current manual dismantling activities in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: none. The value for the dismantling facility has been taken from the electronics waste industry, a dataset that has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
